medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash on light tan laid paper
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.

texts.textentryhtml:
From Oberhuber and Goldfarb, “Disegni di Tiziano…”: Correctly attributed by Tietze to Domenico Campagnola; c. 1517/18; (See reference Bib. 4425);

Provenance: Édouard André [?], as reported probably by Mather; Frank Jewett Mather Jr.;

bibliography.boilertext: Konrad Oberhuber and Hilliard Goldfarb, Disegni di Tiziano e della sua cerchia: catalogo, (Vicenza: N. Pozza, 1976).
bibliography.citation: Konrad Oberhuber and Hilliard Goldfarb, Disegni di Tiziano e della sua cerchia: catalogo, (Vicenza: N. Pozza, 1976)., no. 69; p. 124-125 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Michael Bury, "The 'Triumph of Christ', after Titian", Burlington magazine 131, no. 1032 (Mar., 1989): p. 188-197.
bibliography.citation: Michael Bury, "The 'Triumph of Christ', after Titian", Burlington magazine 131, no. 1032 (Mar., 1989): p. 188-197., p. 194, fig. 6; p. 195

bibliography.boilertext: Hans Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries (New York: J.J. Augustin Publisher, 1944).
bibliography.citation:
Hans Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries (New York: J.J. Augustin Publisher, 1944).
, no. 568

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014)., p. 18, cat. no. 7; p. 19 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
bibliography.citation: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977)., Vol. 1: pp. 48-49, no. 135 (illustrated in Vol. 2 under the same catalog number)
